intro: Wilckea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and includes several species, such as Wilckea acuminata and Wilckea africana. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often with woody stems and alternate leaves. Wilckea species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
